thread.title: Severe thunderstorms likely to bring large hailstones, heavy rain to south-east Queensland - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Severe thunderstorms likely to bring large hailstones, heavy rain to south-east Queensland - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

title: Severe thunderstorms likely to bring large hailstones, heavy rain to south-east Queensland - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
External Link: Isobel Roe on Twitter: The rains are 'ere! And it could not be more welcomed 
The BOM has issued a severe weather warning for people in the Ipswich, Lockyer Valley and parts of the Logan, Somerset, Scenic Rim, South Burnett, Toowoomba and Brisbane City council areas. 
The warning, issued at 4:50pm, said severe thunderstorms were detected on the weather radar near Grantham, the area north-west of Esk, Harrisville, Helidon, the area south of Helidon and the area west of Toogoolawah. 
The storms are moving towards the north-east and are forecast to affect Laidley, Gatton, Peak Crossing, Toogoolawah, Blackbutt and the area north of Gatton by 5:20pm and Ipswich, the area south of Esk, the area west of Kilcoy, Hatton Vale, Moore and Linville by 5:50pm. 
A lighting strike from an earlier storm sparked a grass fire at Regency Downs in the Lockyer Valley. 
Queensland Fire and Emergency Services advised that people should: Move your car under cover or away from trees Secure loose outdoor items Never drive, walk or ride through flood waters. If it's flooded, forget it Seek shelter, preferably indoors and never under trees Avoid using the telephone during a thunderstorm Beware of fallen trees and powerlines For emergency assistance contact the SES on 132 500
